title: Can you describe the great epic Ramayana briefly? Is Lord Rama mentioned in the Bhagavad Gita? - Quora
tags: Shri Rama (seventh avatar of the God Vishnu)

response.answer_text: This is the reference in bhagwad gita as asked by you, पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम्। झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी।।10.31।। "Among the purifiers (or the speeders) I am the wind; Rama among the warriors am I; among the fishes I am the shark; among the streams I am the Ganga." aadau raama tapovanaadi gamanam hatvaa mrugam kaanchanamvaidehee haraNam jaTaayu maraNam sugreeva sambhaash aNam |baalee nigrahaNam samudra taraNam lankaapuree daahanampashchaat raavaNa kumbhakarNa hananametaddhi raamaayaNam Iti ekashlokee raamaayaNam sampoorNam || this is the story is of rama the great born in illustrious surya vansha to dasharatha and Kausalya who to fulfill the boons given by his father went into exile with his wife and brother, protected the rishis who were doing pennace and slew demons primarily ravan, kumbhakarn, meghnaad etc. Once when Rama was sent to the forest, He chased a deer, meanwhile, Sita was kidnapped, Jatayu was killed. Then there were discussions and planning with Sugreeva for the war, Vali was killed, the ocean was crossed and Lanka was burnt. Then Lord Rama, slayed Kumbakarna and Ravana and rescued Goddess Sita . This is the story of Ramayana.
It is said that wherever Hanumanji is present Srirama is also present.The flag on Arjun's ratha has Hanumanji sitting on it so Srirama’s presence is implied.
